data.text:
Bob Black’s scrutiny of the costs of the Scottish parliament building led to key changes in the procurement and construction of future public buildings. Work began on Enric Miralles’s Holyrood complex in 1999, but by the time the first debate was held there in 2004 the cost had risen tenfold from the original estimate of £40 million to more than £400 million. The problem, Black said in a critical report of the project’s management, had been an absence of leadership. “There was no single point of leadership and control,” he wrote, adding that the management had not kept consultants’ fees under review.
